title: 105_hr17
content: The "IRA Savings Opportunity Act of 1997" is the short title of this Act. It includes modifications to individual retirement plans. The "IRA Savings Opportunity Act of 1997" includes amendments to income limitations, phaseout range extension, and additional nondeductible contributions for certain individuals. The "IRA Savings Opportunity Act of 1997" allows for additional contributions for individuals not active in employer plans, with a $2,000 increase for those not defined as active participants. This amount is subject to reduction based on adjusted gross income. The "IRA Savings Opportunity Act of 1997" allows for additional contributions for individuals not active in employer plans, with a $2,000 increase for those not defined as active participants. The excess of the taxpayer's adjusted gross income over the applicable dollar amount determines the reduction in the additional contribution amount. Subsections of section 408 are amended to increase the contribution limit to $4,000. The contribution limit for IRAs is increased to $4,000, disregarding certain limitations and calculations. Eligibility for IRA deduction is determined without considering the spouse's participation in a pension plan. 219(g) of the Code is amended to remove the deduction limitation for active participants in certain pension plans. Additionally, a new section is added to provide an alternative credit for lower income taxpayers in relation to nonrefundable personal credits. SEC. 24. RETIREMENT SAVINGS. The text discusses a tax credit for individuals based on retirement savings contributions. The credit is equal to 20% of the deduction amount under section 219. There is a limitation on the credit based on adjusted gross income, where the credit amount is reduced proportionally to the excess of the taxpayer's adjusted gross income over a specified amount. The text discusses limitations on the tax credit for retirement savings contributions based on adjusted gross income. The applicable dollar amounts for different filing statuses are specified, with rounding rules for calculations. No deduction is allowed under section 219 for amounts paid by or on behalf of an individual. The text discusses limitations on the tax credit for retirement savings contributions based on adjusted gross income. No deduction is allowed under section 219 for amounts paid by or on behalf of an individual. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections for subpart A. The amendments regarding retirement savings in Sec. 24 will apply to taxable years after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 3 coordinates the IRA deduction limit with the elective deferral limit. SEC. 3 amends the Internal Revenue Code to coordinate the IRA deduction limit with the elective deferral limit for taxable years after the enactment of the Act.
